item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 23, 2025 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The SeL4 Microkernel: An Introduction [pdf] (50 points | 4 comments)
2. Ask HN: Difficulties with Going Back to School (24 points | 37 comments)
3. argp: GNU-style command line argument parser for Go (38 points | 14 comments)
4. The Worst Programmer I Know (2023) (82 points | 44 comments)
5. Improving recommendation systems and search in the age of LLMs (256 points | 61 comments)
6. The case of the critical section that let multiple threads enter a block of code (55 points | 24 comments)
7. Next.js and the corrupt middleware: the authorizing artifact (41 points | discuss)
8. Feral pig meat transmits rare bacteria (100 points | 57 comments)
9. How to create value objects in Ruby – the idiomatic way (18 points | 1 comment)
10. Hadrius (YC W23) Is Hiring Engineers with Ambitious Career Goals ( | hide)
11. EmptyEpsilon open source spaceship bridge simulator (104 points | 11 comments)
12. Tencent's 'Hunyuan-T1'–The First Mamba-Powered Ultra-Large Model (251 points | 143 comments)
13. PyTorch Internals: Ezyang's Blog (367 points | 22 comments)
14. The polar vortex is hitting the brakes (216 points | 228 comments)
15. Map Features in OpenStreetMap with Computer Vision (265 points | 59 comments)
16. Do Viruses Trigger Alzheimer's? (112 points | 64 comments)
17. Landrun: Sandbox any Linux process using Landlock, no root or containers (393 points | 118 comments)
18. Euclid opens data treasure trove, offers glimpse of deep fields (12 points | discuss)
19. Next.js version 15.2.3 has been released to address a security vulnerability (167 points | 120 comments)
20. 300-year-old Polish beech voted Tree of the Year (142 points | 38 comments)
21. Scientists program stem cells to mimic first days of embryonic development (25 points | 5 comments)
22. A single-fibre computer enables textile networks and distributed inference (28 points | 5 comments)
23. Stop using the elbow criterion for k-means (44 points | 12 comments)
24. Quitting an Intel x86 Hypervisor (96 points | 15 comments)
25. Most AI value will come from broad automation, not from R & D (105 points | 130 comments)
26. Matched and Deleted (54 points | 27 comments)
27. Through a Glass Lushly: Michalina Janoszanka's Reverse Paintings (Ca. 1920s) (52 points | 4 comments)
28. Metabolism Can Shape Cells' Destinies (43 points | 1 comment)
29. Crabtime: Zig’s Comptime in Rust (440 points | 167 comments)
30. Unknown microorganisms used marble and limestone as a habitat (8 points | 1 comment)
